intro: Dunalia steinbachii, commonly known as the African violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with upright stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it is prized for its ornamental value in horticulture. Dunalia steinbachii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade.
